item.title: DNC 2020: Biden vows to end Trump's 'season of darkness'
item.description: Newly minted Democratic White House nominee implores voters to reject Mr Trump in November's election.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK tourists face new quarantine deadline race
item.description: Holidaymakers who wish to avoid self-isolation need to get back to the UK before new rules kick in on Saturday.

item.title: UK government debt hits Â£2tn for first time
item.description: The government now owes more than 100% of GDP for the first time in 60 years.

item.title: France: Virus cases spike to 4,700 in a day
item.description: Spain, Germany and Italy are also seeing their highest daily case numbers for months.

item.title: Coronavirus: Croatia off safe travel list and France cases spike
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Friday morning.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: Plane leaves Germany to collect 'poisoned' Russian opposition leader
item.description: Doctors treating the Russian opposition figure, who is in a coma, say he cannot travel.

item.title: Taylor Swift's cash gift helps student take up degree
item.description: A London-based Portuguese student has had her "dreams come true" after the gift to fund her at university.

item.title: Coronavirus antibodies tests 'put public at risk'
item.description: Home test kits that claim to show whether someone has had the virus need urgent scrutiny, researchers say.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eviction day fears for worried tenants in England and Wales
item.description: Eviction cases resume on Monday - but with new restrictions - in contrast to elsewhere in the UK.

item.title: Steve Bannon charged with fraud over Mexico wall funds
item.description: Ex-Trump adviser Steve Bannon is charged with fraud over fundraising to build a Mexican border wall.

item.title: Coronavirus: Job shortage sees 1,000 people chase one position
item.description: Data reveals vacancy adverts are down by 59% compared with last summer, with some areas down 80%.

item.title: Two gold nuggets worth $350,000 found in Australia
item.description: The discovery of the 2.5kg stones in Victoria state was shown on TV programme Aussie Gold Hunters.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Record GCSE results and 55 years for Manchester bomb plotter
item.description: The 55-year minimum jail sentence given to Hashem Abedi appears on some of Friday's front pages.

item.title: Warakurna: How an all-Aboriginal police station brought 'huge' change
item.description: Western Australia's first Indigenous-run police station has helped to transform lives, elders say.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Why was a wild boar back in the news?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Glass blower Chris Day reflects Black Lives Matter in his art
item.description: Chris Day, who thinks he is the UK's only black glass blower, has an exhibition in London.

item.title: Listed landscapes: Twenty post-war sites protected
item.description: Housing estate gardens and industrial sites are among the post-war landscapes to be Grade II listed.

item.title: 'Mummified' plants give glimpse of Earth's future
item.description: Fossilised leaves suggest some plants may adapt to grow more quickly as CO2 levels rise.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'My dad built me a beauty salon in the garden'
item.description: Some parents have gone to great lengths in order to help their children start a career in a pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why many are still shielding.... With no end in sight
item.description: Thousands are still in unofficial lockdown because they don't feel safe going out, says BBC disability correspondent Nikki Fox.

item.title: DNC 2020: Joe Biden convention speech fact-checked
item.description: Joe Biden made claims about coronavirus and unemployment in his first major speech as the Democratic presidential nominee.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of catching it from food packaging?
item.description: Some cases around the world have been linked to packaging on frozen food.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why Spain is seeing second wave
item.description: Spain has Europe's fastest-rising caseload two months after it lifted one of the strictest lockdowns.

item.title: Call of Duty: The twins who 'stole' grandad's internet now playing for millions
item.description: Bradley and Matthew Marshall, (AKA Skrapz and Wuskin) on the Call of Duty World Championships.

item.title: Stress, burnout and redundancy: Tough times in IT
item.description: More staff working from home means more work for IT staff, but many face uncertainty over their jobs.

item.title: Lili Reinhart: Being bisexual is not just 'a phase'
item.description: The Riverdale star talks about her sexuality and why her new film is not "another teen romance".

item.title: Coronavirus: Youthful Pakistan appears to avoid worst of pandemic
item.description: Testing in Pakistan has been low, but the country seems to have suffered less than its neighbours.

item.title: Root calls for final push to seal series win against Pakistan
item.description: Captain Joe Root asks his England team for "one big push" in the third and final Test against Pakistan.

item.title: Scotland's Matthew four shots off lead in Women's Open at Troon
item.description: Scotland's Catriona Matthew is four shots off the lead after a level-par 71 in the first round of the AIG Women's Open at Royal Troon.

item.title: Key Pakistan trio on bubble life, Anderson and more
item.description: As the third Test against England starts, Pakistan's Yasir Shah, Naseem Shah and Shan Masood speak about life in the cricket bubble, facing James Anderson and more.

item.title: Glasgow City must 'accelerate' preparations for Wolfsburg test
item.description: Head coach Scott Booth says his Glasgow City players have had to accelerate their preparations for their Champions League last-eight tie against Wolfsburg.

item.title: Liverpool's Wijnaldum a top target for Barca - Friday's football gossip
item.description: Koeman wants Wijnaldum at Barca, Magalhaes delays Arsenal decision, PSG monitoring Dalot, Deeney wants to stay at Watford, plus more.

item.title: Liverpool v Leeds United: Classic Tony Yeboah, James Milner and Harry Kewell Premier League goals
item.description: Leeds will travel to Anfield to face champions Liverpool in their first Premier League match for 16 years - to celebrate here are some memorable Leeds goals in the top division, including Tony Yeboah's iconic strike against the Reds in 1995.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Quarantine: Do I have to self isolate?
item.description: If you have to observe a 14-day isolation period after travelling from certain countries, here's what you need to know.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?
